title: What is the title of land held by a marquess? - Quora

response.answer_text: A marquess(marquise feminine) or commonly translated as: Marquis(French), Margrave(Markgraf in German), Marquês(Portuguese), Margravio(Italian), Marqués(Castillian), Marchiz(Romanian), Marquès(Catalan), Marchio(Latin), Rules over a marquisate, margravate, or a march. The March once was a border country, but over time evolved into just a title of prestige. These titles were originally granted more prestige because they would defend the realm and needed more autonomy to do so.  These are the margraves of the Holy Roman Empire: Moravia, Meissen, Brandenburg, and Baden
